info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Pleasant Hills, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Cheviot, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, Dayton, Finneytown, West Chester and Ross. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 17. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 19. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
